## GAD-7 vs AEBQ

In the world of psychology research, comparing and harmonising the items across different questionnaires can be a challenging and time-consuming process. An example would be comparing GAD-7 (Generalised Anxiety Disorder Assessment) and AEBQ (Adult Eating Behaviour Questionnaire). The GAD-7 vs AEBQ comparison would involve matching items related to anxiety and eating behaviours. To streamline and enhance this complicated process, a sophisticated tool called Harmony poses an incredible solution that psychologists might want to utilize. Harmony is a ground-breaking software developed specifically to aid researchers in harmonising questionnaire items across different studies, even if the studies are in different languages. A great illustration of how Harmony can be applied in comparative analysis is seen in the GAD-7 vs AEBQ instance. Harmony utilizes large language models to compare items in these questionnaires. GAD-7, a tool used to measure the severity of generalised anxiety disorder, can be accurately compared with AEBQ, which assesses adult eating behaviour. Consequently, Harmony gives a percentage match between each item in GAD-7 and AEBQ, enabling users to derive meaningful conclusions. The excellent user interface of Harmony allows researchers to select instruments from its database or upload their own instruments in PDF form. In our case of GAD-7 vs AEBQ, it simplifies the comparison through its high-end natural language processing and generative AI models. Embracing software like Harmony not only simplifies the process of questionnaire harmonisation but also expands the scope of comparative psychology research. It reaffirms the relevance of software development in the psychology research field by enabling the accurate comparison and harmonisation of different studies, such as GAD-7 vs AEBQ.

## Compare the items in GAD-7 English and AEBQ

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import GAD-7 and AEBQ into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just GAD-7 into Harmony</a> - compare GAD-7 English with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just AEBQ into Harmony</a> - compare AEBQ with other instruments


## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
